name: Bienville House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week at this hotel, which I chose for location, although the prices were quite good.The free breakfast buffet was extensive, with a helpful little lady serving as hostess. I walk with a cane, so I found a step-free ramp to the main street, two city blocks to the waterfront, close to the cathedral, street cars and every classy restaurant in the French Quarter....we walked everywhere, every day, with great ease. We did not visit the Jazz joints, but the Hard Rock and House of Blues were visible nearby. We did not know the Music Fest was going on, and a few days later Navy Day /tall ships came to the park...Really great ! The tour buses left the Jax Brewery depot, the paddleboat tour and carriage rides were all very close. Coming and going to the airport, the shuttle seemed to avoid heavy traffic by some quick routes...effortless travel. This bouteque hotel is located just right....try it....you'll love it !
reviews.title: great spot for disabled

reviews.text: Stayed for four nights in April and had a great stay. The complimentary wifi & breakfast was a nice bonus. The location in the French Quarter was perfect-everything we wanted to see was close by. The staff were friendly and efficient. The rates seemed high but I think this was because there was a festival on would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect location with lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have been visiting New Orleans for over 25 years. Have stayed in many nice hotels during this time including the Marriott, Westin, and the Monteleone, a sister property. It was through an e-mail from the Monteleone about three years ago that we learned about the Bienville House. We decided to try it, fell in love with it, and will never stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Wonderful Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is superb. Pretty much a 2-3 block walk from Bourbon street, Canal Place, Riverwalk, The Aquarium, Jackson Square, and the St. Charles streetcar. A little further to the French Market, but straight down Decatur St. from the hotel.
reviews.title: March Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel is absolutely superb, with none of the indifference frequently experienced in large cities. On our first trip we were treated wonderfully. On subsequent trips we were always welcomed as returning guests. They will do anything possible to see that you have a pleasant and comfortable stay. The valet parking is probably the best in New Orleans, and among the least expensive at $20.00 / night. Others have run from $30.00 to $40.00 per night. From valet parking to the front desk is only a few steps. Wi-Fi is now free. If you are a breakfast person they offer a complimentary continental breakfast with various types of rolls, fruit, juices, milk, and an absolutely wonderful coffee.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bienville House in a 4th floor room with our own terrace and it was lovely! The room was a very good size and had ceiling to floor windows with full shutters to keep the place cool. The bed was very comfortable and the decor lovely. Absolutely no bad bits at all in regard to the rooms, terrace, lobby etc. Also very well positioned. An slight negative would be the breakfast - plastic plates, cutlery etc - but all in all a fantastic hotel!
reviews.title: Beautiful boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A charming hotel with friendly staff who go out of their way to make you feel welcome. We arrived before check in so they held our luggage and offered suggestions as to where we could get a good breakfast/lunch in the area. We were very happy with our spacious room, filled with antiques. It felt like we were in someone's guest room, not a hotel room. The king size bed was comfortable. The balcony overlooking the courtyard allowed us to relax while still hearing the sounds of the city. The staff made reservations for us for the tours. The continental breakfast that is offered is better than at most hotels. Make sure you plan to have dinner at the restaurant Iris, that is attached to the hotel. Excellent food, great staff, order a cocktail, sit in the courtyard and ENJOY!
reviews.title: A Gem Of a Hotel

reviews.text: Spent 3 days in New Orleans. Properties are older, but well-kept. Staff was very friendly and offered many suggestions of places to see. Continental breakfast was perfect, bagels, yogart, fruit, pastries. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Good location -- just far enough away from the craziness of Bourbon Street. Best restaurant we found was Brennan's Bourbon Oyster House, corner of Bourbon and Iberville (I think). There were 12 of us and we all loved it so much we had dinner there twice. Bootleggers had some fantastic blues bands playing - so make sure you check that out. Also went to Mardi Gras World. Shuttle picks you up, go on a tour to see all the floats, how them make them, new floats for next year -- really nice to see. A few things I think are overrated: Acme Oyster House, Johnny's Po-Boys and sadly, the beignets. Yes, the are good, but really, they are a larger piece of funnel cake.
reviews.title: Fun trip to NOLA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean hotel, nice breakfast in the morning, some of the friendliest staff I've ever encountered at a hotel, GREAT location! Walking distance to everything
reviews.title: Wonderful location, friendliest staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice quaint hotel with an amazing courtyard. The first impressions of our room was literally breathtaking. The AC unit was loud in the hallway by the ice machine and the trim in the bathroom was cheaply done, but for a building built in the late 1700's with so much history, that can be overlooked. We also had trouble with the bathtub holding water, the TV kept losing cable signal (all HD stations didn't work at all), and the bathroom flowers and ceiling fan were COVERED with dust. We complained at the front desk and were offered a different room but it was SO much smaller for only the price of the parking for our car taken off and it wasn't worth that much to us. We just didn't turn the fan on and we hid the flowers under the cabinet so we didn't have to look at them. For the price, I would expect a fridge/microwave in the room, and the breakfast was very limited (breads and coffee only). The setting for the hotel was the perfect distance from the hustle and noise of downtown (minus the blare of the steam ship every now and then) but also to be close enough that you don't feel you are missing out. I do believe upon another chance to go to the city, we would still likely go back.
reviews.title: A Historic Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bienville House is in a perfect location for travelers to New Orleans. Very nicely decorated, with a cute courtyard and pool. We had a third floor room with a balcony view to the courtyard. Only problem with the room was that there were two double beds, very tight sleeping in a double if you're used to a king or queen. We found it easy to walk to the Market and Riverside as well as the French Quarter. We found the staff to be somewhat disinterested in their guests, not very helpful. Other than that, it was a great choice for our short visit.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Last week was the first time we stayed at this property even though we visit New Orleans often. I was a little skeptical because of some of the reviews but I thought we would give it a try. WE WERE VERY PLEASED.....with the service from the staff (very helpful and welcoming)), cleanliness (no bugs as suggested in a previous review)....it had an outstanding continental breakfast.....the overall experience was EXCELLENT...The location to all the attractions in New Orleans was perfect. Also, we had the interior rooms that were very quiet and the beds were wonderful!!!
reviews.title: Well Worth the Money!!!
BeaU-tifully Decorated an intimate pleasure
reviews.text: You should give it a try....I think you wil be very satisfied with the rates and the hospitality and the overall presentation of the property. DJC, Lake Charles, LA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel if you like an intimate elegant rather than corporate monster experience. This place had a decorator who did it right...even .the bathroom soaps are on a silver tray that has doilies under the glasses and the roof is made into a private garden space,..the complimentary continental breakfast is generous and server is sweet and helpful... This staff has been together and it shows..The pool is a relaxing oasis but needs to be heated to be swimable .nevertheless this place gets a strong recommendation in my book. Excellent, Very
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was everything I was looking for during our stay in New Orleans. The hotel is located near the end of Decatur Street closer to the financial district/downtown so it's a bit recessed from the hubbub of the heart of French Quarter but a VERY short walk to hubbub if that's what you want. I wanted a little bit of quiet at night to sleep so I was fine with not being in the middle of the ruckus. Decatur Street also happens to have lots of great bars, shops and restaurants all along it, and if you're a relatively fast walker, you can get to almost anywhere in the French Quarter walking within 20-30 minutes. Our room was very quiet and I was never woken up once, even though we were right across the street from a fire station and our window faced it. I wasn't even sure the firemen ever went out! A handful of amazing restaurants are right around the corner from the hotel, including Antoine's (highly recommended, as a side note), which is one of the oldest restaurants in New Orleans and home of the original Oysters Rockefeller. I would absolutely come back for another stay at this affordable French Quarter hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New Orleans is loaded with hotel options. This one will not disappoint if you you want convenient charm. Lovely courtyard and pool, breakfast (albeit limited) and excellent location is all you need.
reviews.title: Sweet New Orleans Gem

reviews.text: I stay at the Bienville House whenever I go to New Orleans. The hotel and rooms are always clean. The staff is wonderful and knowledgeable. The location is perfect. This is the Hotel I recommend to friends visiting The Big Easy.
reviews.title: This is a great Hotel.

reviews.text: This was a great place to stay during Mardi Gras. It's far enough away from the noise Bourbon Street, but close enough to all the action so you can get there when you feel the need. It's in the French Quarter and central to all the restaurants and shopping. The staff are wonderful and know the area if you need any guidance.
reviews.title: Great price, great location

reviews.text: We stayed in a room with a small balcony which overlooked the beautiful courtyard and swimming pool. By the way, I swam in the pool most every morning. Very refreshing.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Angela booked our stay and I can't say enough about her. She went out of her way to ensure our group had a great experience and is very knowledgeable about Mardi Gras and what to see & do while there. This made our stay even more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Ideal Location

description: Just as the French Quarter is perfectly situated in the heart of New Orleans, the Bienville House New Orleans hotel is perfectly situated in the midst of the historic French Quarter. Having just completed a multi-million dollar renovation, the 83-room hotel is a truly distinctive downtown New Orleans hotel establishment.  It has a sense of style and grace only to be found in America’s most interesting city, within this New Orleans' boutique hotel accommodations in the French Quarter.
